SearchPairs

Source: R/SearchPairs.r
SearchPairs.Rd

Compute pairs of genomic features that share a same range constraintes.

Usage

SearchPairs(
  indexAnchor.gnr = NULL,
  indexBait.gnr = NULL,
  minDist.num = NULL,
  maxDist.num = NULL,
  verbose.bln = TRUE,
  cores.num = 1
)

Arguments

indexAnchor.gnr

<GRanges>: GRanges used in the first part of the pairs.

indexBait.gnr

<GRanges>: GRanges used in the second part of the pars. If NULL is replace with indexAnchor.gnr (Default NULL)

minDist.num

<numeric>: the minimal distance between first and second parts of pairs. (Default NULL)

maxDist.num

<numeric>: the maximal distance between first and second parts of pairs. (Default NULL)

verbose.bln

<logical>: A logical value. If TRUE show the progression in console. (Default TRUE)

cores.num

<integer> : An integer to specify the number of cores. (Default 1)

Value

A GInteractions object.

Examples

library(GenomicED)
data(anchors_Index.gnr)
data(baits_Index.gnr)
interactions.gni <- SearchPairs(
    indexAnchor.gnr = anchors_Index.gnr,
    indexBait.gnr   = baits_Index.gnr,
    minDist.num     = 9000, 
    maxDist.num     = 11000,
    cores.num       = 1,
    verbose.bln     = FALSE
    )
interactions.gni
